Black Business Magazine is the UK’s leading publication dedicated to celebrating, supporting, and spotlighting Black entrepreneurs, professionals, and changemakers. As a platform rooted in empowerment and representation, the magazine shares inspiring stories, expert insights, and practical strategies to help readers grow thriving businesses and impactful careers. With each quarterly issue, we showcase excellence across sectors from tech and finance to fashion, wellness, and the arts, while addressing the systemic barriers faced by Black communities. More than just a magazine, we’re a movement creating space for visibility, connection, and legacy-building. From thought-provoking editorials to high-profile cover features and community-driven events, Black Business Magazine continues to champion innovation, equity, and entrepreneurial success. As proud media partners, we’re honoured to amplify voices and ideas shaping the future. Join us in rewriting the narrative, one story at a time.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

BELOVD is a human strategy and innovation consultancy founded by Marvyn Harrison. It helps organisations redesign how they work, communicate, and evolve by centring people, culture, and technology at the core of transformation. Core Purpose: To advance all intersections of humanity in the workplace — meaning BELOVD builds more inclusive, emotionally intelligent, and future-ready environments where people can thrive and businesses can scale with purpose.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

We are an award-winning, innovative platform that serves as the UKs first ever leading voice for Black privacy professionals; a community that is committed to leading AI conversations creating solutions for greater equality and equity within the privacy sector, and the related data and technology sectors too. We represent the largest gathering of Black AI and privacy professionals in Europe. We strive to work with Black privacy professionals, regulators, allies, companies and organisations who share our vision and are equally committed to contributing practically for those either aspiring to be or making their way in the privacy profession. Our aim is to build connections to create opportunities that unlock the full potential of diverse Artificial Intelligence (AI) and privacy talent while elevating career and business success for members. We do this by providing members with access to: * exclusive member-only networking events * innovative knowledge-sharing opportunities * comprehensive learning and development programmes * tailored mentorship programmes.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

blackprivacyprofessionals.com

Black Apprentice Network is all about connecting diverse, underrepresented talent with top employers through apprenticeship and early-career opportunities. Started by Elijah, Kwesi and Rubin, who are either current ot former apprentices, who are really into increasing Black African and Caribbean representation in the workforce, BAN has grown into a thriving community of over 5,000 members. The network provides essential resources like mentorship, resume workshops, and interview prep to help candidates navigate the competitive job market.

BAN partners with leading early talent teams at large UK apprenticeship employers such as Accenture, Norton Rose Fulbright, and BT, working to help them create diverse pipelines by providing access to a highly motivated and diverse pool of talent within their community. Through targeted events, webinars, and skill-building initiatives, BAN equips young professionals with the tools to succeed. The organization is a vital platform for aspiring apprentices and early-career professionals, committed to breaking down barriers and empowering underrepresented groups in their pursuit of career success.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

GTA Black Women In Tech is a not-for-profit organisation. Founded in September 2019, it is the 2nd largest working group of the Tech London Advocates Group. GTA Black Women in Tech is part of a network of more than 20,000 tech leaders, entrepreneurs and experts in London, across the UK and in over 50 countries worldwide. Proudly independent, private sector-led, and not backed by the government, Tech London Advocates fundamentally believes that London is one of the world’s leading tech hubs. Our mission is to inspire, support and connect the tech sphere to allow more black women to excel and tech companies to perform better through diversity and inclusion.

Career Sistas is a platform founded by Beverly Vanterpool to champion women—particularly Black women and women of colour—through key career transitions and professional growth. Rooted in knowledge-sharing, storytelling, and community, Career Sistas connects women across industries through its podcast Stories by Career Sistas and other digital resources. The platform’s first publication, Build Your Table—a career guide based on Vanterpool’s personal experiences working for multinational companies in the UK—will be released in Autumn 2025. Diverse Business Network is a space for Business Owners from Diverse and Minoritised Backgrounds, intersections and Allys, to network and support each other. Our ethos is to build a values-based business community which is inclusive, safe, supportive and enables leaders to affect positive change. Our Diverse collaborative community connects underrepresented business owners, entrepreneurs and professionals with specialist support services and meaningful representation to empower them on their journey. We offer a comprehensive, sustainable and supportive ecosystem which fosters an inclusive network improving growth and resilience of diverse businesses. The Diverse Business Network enables and equips members to reach their potential to overcome barriers. We achieve this by providing information, learning, collaboration, coaching and connections through our trusted partnerships, we have drawn together from around the UK.

Legally Diverse, a platform where I provide advice and mentorship to aspiring solicitors hoping to enter the profession. In the past two years I have worked with several organisations to further my goal of making the legal profession more accessible and diverse. These organisations include: * LawCareers.Net; * All About Law; * Vantage; * Little Law; and * the Commercial Law Academy. In October 2023, I launched a brand new resource for aspiring lawyers called the Legally Diverse Networking Cards. The deck of cards feature 92 questions for aspiring lawyers to ask those in the profession when attending law firms and/or legal networking events. The cards have been colour coded to indicate the best questions to ask people in the recruitment teams, trainees, associates and partners. Legally Diverse, a platform where I provide advice and mentorship to aspiring solicitors hoping to enter the profession. In the past two years I have worked with several organisations to further my goal of making the legal profession more accessible and diverse. These organisations include: * LawCareers.Net; * All About Law; * Vantage; * Little Law; and * the Commercial Law Academy. In October 2023, I launched a brand new resource for aspiring lawyers called the Legally Diverse Networking Cards. The deck of cards feature 92 questions for aspiring lawyers to ask those in the profession when attending law firms and/or legal networking events. The cards have been colour coded to indicate the best questions to ask people in the recruitment teams, trainees, associates and partners. The aim of the cards is to ensure that aspiring solicitors leave these events feeling as though they have learnt enough valuable information to better their application forms, interviews and understanding of the profession in practice.

Pick Up The Mic is a London-based social enterprise supporting young creatives, students, and entrepreneurs through podcasts, events, and development programmes. We amplify underrepresented voices, build confidence, and boost access to opportunities. Since 2021, we’ve produced 400+ podcast episodes, run workshops, and launched the Fund & Flourish Lab—a six-month programme with mentoring, peer support, and creative commissions. We also offer media services like podcast production and branded content, led by programme alumni. Our model blends content, coaching, and creativity to drive impact and income.

ThinkForward provides long-term coaching that gets young people ready for the world of work. We develop the skills that young people need, help them overcome the challenges they face and facilitate employability activities to broaden their horizons and provide experience of the workplace.Our Vision That every young person is empowered to gain the confidence, independence and skills they need for a better and brighter future. Our Mission ThinkForward delivers unique, personalised coaching programmes for young people at a key stage in their lives, enabling them to overcome the challenges they face and make a successful transition into work. Every young person takes part in workplace activities to develop their life goals and readiness for work. We raise the voices of our young people and support employers to provide fair access to opportunities.

The UK Black Comms Network exists to increase the number and seniority of Black professionals in the UK PR and Marketing industry. We are always interested in partnering with employers who wish to demonstrate their support and commitment to their Black talent, promote retention, and support us by hosting events should that be of interest in the future. We believe that providing peer-to-peer networking and professional development opportunities and using our convening power to highlight issues and enact change will be the difference our industry needs to ensure that Black comms professionals remain and thrive in the comms industry. Established in 2020, we have amassed 350+ members across all experience levels and sectors, with new members joining us daily. Our website receives, on average 1k unique visits each month, and we have an engaged following across social media, including linked in, instagram and twitter, with a reach of more than 10k.

For nearly four decades, the Walsall Black Sisters Collective (WBSC) has worked tirelessly to uplift Walsall’s diverse communities. Our wide-ranging programmes provide vital support, from helping vulnerable women and offering mental health services to running a food bank and day care for older adults. We are committed to addressing urgent needs while strengthening community bonds, promoting equality, and celebrating cultural heritage.

Hustle+Heels began in 2014 with a simple idea: to create a space where ambitious women could access valuable business support to help them start, grow and improve their passion projects. It started with a lunch—just us, Jen and Jay, and a small group of women. That intimate gathering sparked a movement. Since then, we’ve supported thousands of women through workshops, events, and strategy sessions, growing a vibrant online community of over 15,000 members. Our mission remains the same: to offer real, practical advice and connections to help women succeed—no fluff, no jargon, just honest support from one woman to another.

BSGN is a global platform dedicated to elevating Black women and other marginalised professionals into leadership, entrepreneurship, and boardroom roles. eFinancialCareers, is the world’s leading financial services and technology careers platform. For our finance professionals, we provide the latest job opportunities, career information and invaluable industry insights they need to maximise their potential. For our recruiters or HR professionals we provide a vital competitive edge by enabling them to source highly qualified professionals they need to achieve their strategic ambitions – quickly and efficiently.
